dialogues.speaker: GRAPHIC
dialogues.text: It is set against the obvious skyline of Las Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lair is 1960's high-tech.  We see a huge oversized  conference table with six scary-looking EVIL ASSOCIATES,  including a Latin American REVOLUTIONARY in a field jacke and turtleneck, TWIN NORDIC DOCTORS, and a METER MAID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (face always unseen) Gentlemen, are we all here?  Good.   As you know, my plot to high-jack  nuclear weapons and hold the world  hostage has failed.  Again.  This  organization will not tolerate  failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses a button.  The Revolutionary, the twin Nordic  doctors, and the meter maid's chairs tip back and fall into a pit.  Their chairs return empty and  smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mustafa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON:  MUSTAFA, an Arab with a red Fez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frau Farbissina...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON FRAU FARBISSINA in a severe Salvation Army unifo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spared your lives because I need  you to help me rid the world of the  only man who can stop me now.  We  must go to London.  I've set a trap  for Austin Powers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC:  Soul Bossanova by QUINCY JONES. We start on a pair of BEATLE BOOTS and peg-top crushed ve pants walking down the street in rhythm, Г  la Saturday N Fever. We pan up to reveal AUSTIN POWERS, International Man of  Mystery.  He's a swinger, with medium-length Mod hair and sideburns and he wears Nationa Health Services glasses. Austin walks along Carnaby Street taking photographs.  It that perpetual bright sunny day you see in Sixties movies Austin, bursting with life, gives a two-handed handshake a MOD FREAK, who's just gotten off a red double-decker bu Austin salutes a strolling BOBBY, then comes across TWO  BEAUTIFUL MOD GIRLS who are excited to see him.  They all start to twist to the music, including the Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: FREEZE FRAMES
dialogues.text: In the middle of the street, THREE MODELS wait impatientl to be photographed in a makeshift photo shoot area. One wears a short-skirted Stewardess outfit.  One wears a metallic silver pantsuit with matching cowl.  The other w a see-through Mary Quant dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking photos) Alright, luv!  Love it!  Turn...pout  for me baby.  Smashing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see that AUSTIN HAS VERY BAD ENGLISH TEETH.  The model the stewardess outfit foes on all fours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy baby.  Give me some shoulder.   Yes!  Yes!  Yes! (beat) No.  No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me love.  Yes!  And...done.  Here you go, luv.  I'm  spent. Austin throws the camera in the air behind him.  An ASSIS scrambles and catches it before it hits the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get these off to Fab Magazine right  away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, you've really outdone yourself  this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suggestively) We could have another photo session  back at my flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coyly) Oh, behave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, I love you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So many women, so little time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gaggle of MOD GIRLS come towards the shoot site.  They  recognize Austin and SCREAM hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Austin Powers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin runs away.  The mob chases after him a la Hard Day Night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two BAD GUYS attack Austin.  He JUDO CHOPS them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judo chop!  Judo chop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mob of girls catches up to Austin and he runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin's in a phone booth with his back turned.  The mob  runs by.  He steps out, disguised only by a beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin is jiving down the street and comes across a stone face red-coated BUCKINGHAM PALAM GUARD standing at attent just outside his guard box. Austin mugs for the guard, trying to get him to crack up, but to no avail.  Finally, he pulls a big sixties FLOWER  from behind the guard's head and presents it to him.  The both crack up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls run by a Sixties-era photo booth with somebody  inside.  Austin steps out.

dialogues.speaker: THE FILM STRIP
dialogues.text: Panels 1-3 show Austin with various exotic MODELS.  The f panel shows Austin with the QUEEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin spots a VERY PREGNANT HIPPY GIRL with a placard th says "PROTEST!" in a funky font.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might want to protest a bit louder  next time, luv.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: AUSTIN'S PASSPORT
dialogues.text: The passport opens.  We see Austin's dour photo.  Then he gives an insane grin, showing his bad teeth.  The page fl and we see visa stamps from all the exotic places he's be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin flips a coin into a BLIND MAN's cup.  The blind ma obviously sighted, moves the cup to catch the coin.  Aust wags his finger in a "oh, you" fashion, and then proceeds knee him the balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin is being chased around the corner by a GAGGLE OF  SCHOOLGIRLS. After a moment, Austin returns from around the corner wit baton, followed by a MARCHING BAND. The schoolgirls pick up his trail again and he begins to  run. A 1967 Jaguar XKE convertible, which is decorated with a  large Union Jack, pulls beside Austin. He jumps over the door into the moving convertible, racin off just ahead of the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver of the Jag is Austin's associate, MRS. KENSING a beautiful woman in her thirties. They drive against obvious REAR PROJECTION of 1960's Lond

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mrs. Kensington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Austin Just then, a FLASHING  RED LIGHT goes off and we hear a  distinctive PHONE RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be Basil Exposition, Chief  of British Intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glove compartment revolves to reveal a picture phone. ANGLE ON:  PICTURE PHONE SCREEN.  We see BASIL EXPOSITION distinguished older man.  A desk plate reads:  "Basil  Exposition, Chief of British Intelligence."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on picture phone) Hello, Austin.  This is Basil  Exposition, Chief of British  Intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Austin Powers, International Man of Mystery, and y with Agent Mrs. Kensington.  The year is 1967, and you're talking on picture phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know all that, Exposition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to be extremely clear  so that everyone knows what's going  on at any given time.  We've just  received word that Dr. Evil, the  ultimate square, is planning to take  over the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil?  I thought I put him in  jail for good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid not.  Earlier this week,  Dr. Evil escaped from Zedel Edel  Prison in Baaden Baaden and now he's  planning a trap for you tonight at  the Electric Psychedelic Pussycat  Swinger's Club in Picadilly Circus  here in swinging London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A panel revolves to reveal a map of London with lights sh Austin's position and the location of the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just where you'd never think to look  for him.  We'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, Austin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and Austin&emdash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (to Mrs. Kensington) Let's go, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On top of one building is a three-story high BOB'S BIG BO figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jaguar pulls up in front of the swinging nightclub.   Mrs. Kensington steps out of the car, dressed in a tight  leather fightsuit.  She looks fabulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a swinging club.  FREAKS abound.  In one corner, the is a PRESS CONFERENCE in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Austin Powers, it's me, Mick  Jagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you more satisfied now sexually,  Austin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you can't always get what you  want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) "You can't always get what you want!"   That's a great title for a song!   I'm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gonna write that, and it'll be a big hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good on ya, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groovy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vinyl 45 of "You Can't Always Get What You Want."

dialogues.speaker: BILLBOARD CHART
dialogues.text: "You Can't Always Get What You Want" at Number One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one corner ANDY WARHOL sits in front of his multi-colo Elvis (or equivalent).  He body paints a butterfly on the thigh of a MOD GIRL wearing a metallic miniskirt outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin Powers?  Hi, I'm Andy Warhol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, have this can of Campbell's  Tomato Soup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin hands Andy a can of soup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to paint this can of soup  and become famous and not give you  any credit for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can become famous, everyone  will have their fifteen minutes of  fame, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Fifteen minutes of fame?"  I'm going  to use that quote and not give you  any credit for that, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smashing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy Warhol's famous Soup Can painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HER MAJESTY, THE QUEEN is giving Austin a Victoria's Cros like the Lyndon Johnson scene in Forrest Gump.  Behind th are two COLDSTREAM GUARDS and the DUKE OF EDINBURGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin Powers, Britain owes you a  debt of gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin gives a cheeky look to Mrs. Kensington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you were wounded.  Where  were you hit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the but-tocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must be a sight.  I'd kind of  like to see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin turns around, drops his pants, and shows his wound bum (matching Gump's) to the queen. The queen walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Nice buttocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the line-up we also see FOREST GUMP.  He has to pee ve badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to find Dr. Evil!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, I've got an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He PUNCHES a PRETTY MOD GIRL in the face, knocking her ou cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, why in God's name did you  strike that woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't no woman!  It's a man,  man.  It's one of Dr. Evil's  assassins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin pulls off the mod girl's wig.  She is a MALE ASSAS The assassin comes to and leaps to his feet. Mrs. Kensington knocks his feet from under him.  The assa hits the ground and pulls out a dagger.  Mrs. Kensington  kicks the knife out of his hand and Austin gets him in a  head-lock from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Doctor Evil?

dialogues.speaker: FINGER PULLS THE TRIGGER OF A SPEAR
dialogues.text: gun.  The assassin falls forward.  A spear protrudes from his back.  Austin sees Dr. Evil as he runs through a door They give chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter.  Dr. Evil climbs into an egg chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got you again, Dr. Evil!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chair fills with a WHITE MIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unseen, through mist) Not this time.  Come, Mr.  Bigglesworth! (calling out) See you in the future, Mr. Powers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before the doors close, the white CAT jumps in the egg ch A sign on the egg reads "CRYOGENIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God!  He's freezing himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin begins FIRING at the egg chair.  The ceiling opens and the egg rises through the opening.  Everything begins RUMBLE.  Rocket exhaust pours out of the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bob's Big Boy rocket begins to LIFT OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEOPLE outside the club react to the rocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bob's Big Boy rocket leaves the atmosphere.  Mr.  Bigglesworth is pressed to the window like one of those  stuffed Garfields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shivering) I'll be back, Mr. Powers, when free  love is dead, and greed and avarice  once again rule the world.

dialogues.speaker: FULL SCREEN
dialogues.text: A BLIP appears on the radar screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Commander Gilmour?

dialogues.speaker: SPLIT SCREEN 2
dialogues.text: COMMANDER GILMOUR, a distinguished man in his fifties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Commander, this is Slater in SoWest  Com Three.  We have a potential bogey  with erratic vectoring and an  unorthodox entry angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Is it one of ours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Log Com Bird Twelve says its  metalurg recon analysis is a standard  alloy, not stealthy, not carbon- composite. (pause) It does have an odd shape, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears to be in the shape of  Bob's Big Boy, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SCREEN 3
dialogues.text: The rocket is dirty and battered from thirty years in spa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, he's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In many ways, Bob's Big Boy never  left, sir.  He's always offered the  same high quality meals at competitive  prices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we scramble TacHQ for an  intercept?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's its current position?

dialogues.speaker: SCREEN 4
dialogues.text: On the radar screen it says "NEVADA."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was over Nevada, but...oh my God!   It's gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen son, I want you to forget  what you saw here tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander, I have to log it&emdash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a direct order.  You didn't  see a thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up and picks up another phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Philips.

dialogues.speaker: SCREEN 5
dialogues.text: SERGEANT PHILIPS picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the President

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare the jet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get my overnight bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philips, do me a favor and feed my  fish.

dialogues.speaker: SCREEN 9
dialogues.text: A hand enters and sprinkles fish food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hand re-enters and scoops up some of the fish food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to London, England.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basil Exposition (now aged 30 years), Command Gilmour, an NICOLAI BORSCHEVSKY, a Russian General, put on extreme-we gear over their uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you know, gentlemen, Dr. Evil had  himself frozen in 1967.  Soon after,  Austin Powers volunteered to have  himself frozen, in the event Dr.  Evil should ever return.  We believe  Dr. Evil has begun yet another plot  to take over the world.  And that,  gentlemen, is why we're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outstanding re-cap, Exposition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Command Gilmour opens a vault door.  COLD MIST escapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass a row of cryogenic holding berths, each contain a naked PERSON in suspended animation, a la Demolition Ma They pass GARY COLEMAN, EVEL KNIEVAL (with cape), and VAN ICE, all in suspended animation.  They pass a now-empty b with a plate that reads "JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this Austin Powers?  Is he a  British operative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he worked freelance, an  internationally renowned swinging  photographer by day and the ultimate  gentlemen spy by night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, they come across Austin Powers: He is naked.  Hi hands cover up his private parts.  The look on his face  suggests 'Oh my God, my bits and pieces are cold'.  His  glasses are frosted over.  He is very hairy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on PA) Attention, Stage One, laser cutting  beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lasers begin to cut Austin out of the ice in one huge cub

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on PA) Laser cutting complete.  Stage Two,  warm liquid goo phase beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ROBOTIC ARM lifts the cube out of the berth and places into a high-tech melting vat of warm liquid GOO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on PA) Warm liquid goo phases complete.   Stage Three, reanimation beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin comes to life out of the goo on a draining platfor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on PA) Reanimation complete.  Stage Four,  cleansing beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technicians lead a half-asleep Austin to a screened area, where only his feet and head are visible.  He's washed of with a series of hot-water jets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on PA) Cleansing complete.  Stage Five,  evacuation beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's given futuristic inoculations and then led to a scre in toilet area.  We can hear the sound of PEE ENTERING TH BOWL. He PEES for a while, then a little longer. And then EVEN LONGER STILL. The stream seems to be subsiding...then begins STRONGER t ever. He is still PEEING. Finally, it STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evacuation com...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins PEEING again. A little LONGER. Then in short staccato BURSTS. The it STOPS.  Pause. Two DRIPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evacuation... (waiting) Complete!  The cryogenic state of  Austin Powers is now completed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin lies in a bed tilted up in an extreme angle Г  la Frankenstein's lab.  NURSE TECHNICIANS administer injecti and monitor electrodes, IV's, and other biological sensor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in the Ministry of Defense.   It's 1997.  You've been cryogenically  frozen for thirty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) WHO ARE THESE PEOPLE?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shouting is a temporary side- effect of the unfreezing process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm having trouble  controlling&emdash (shouting) THE VOLUME OF MY VOICE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might also experience a slight  fever, dry mouth, and flatulence at  moments of extreme relaxation.   Austin, this is Commander Gilmour,  Strategic Command, and General  Borschevsky, Russian Intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russian Intelligence?  Are you mad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot's happened since you were  frozen, Austin.  The cold war's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.  Those capitalist dogs  will finally pay for their crimes  against the people,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hey Comrades?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won, Austin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groovy.  Smashing!  Good on ya! (to Gilmour) Nice tie.  Yea capitalism!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Powers, the President's very  concerned.  We've got a madman on  the loose in Nevada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Dr. Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do I begin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately.  You'll be working with  Ms. Kensington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Mrs. Kensington?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Austin, Mrs. Kensington has long- since retired.  Ms. Kensington is  her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VANESSA KENSINGTON, Mrs. Kensington's daughter, beautiful mid-Twenties, English, enters.  She is wearing a very  conservative, business pantsuit.  Her hair is up and she  wears glasses.  Austin's breath is taken away. She sets down a huge stack of files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa's one of our top agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out loud, to himself) My God, Vanessa's got a smashing  body.  I bet she shags like a minx.   How do I tell them that because of  the unfreezing process, I have no  inner monologue? (pause) I hope I didn't say that out loud  just now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an uncomfortable SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Powers, my job is to acclimate  you to the Nineties.  You know, a  lot's changed since 1967.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, as long as people are still  having promiscuous sex with many  anonymous partners without protection,  while at the same time experimenting  with mind-expanding

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: drugs in a consequence-free environment, I'll be sound as pound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother's told me all about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's a lie, goddamn her.  It it's  the truth, goddamn me. (pause) God, I hope that's witty.  How's  your mum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother's doing quite well, thank  you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well...Agent Kensington will  get you set up.  She's very dedicated.   Perhaps, a little too dedicated. (aside to Austin) She's got a bit of a bug up her ass.   Good luck, Austin, the world's  depending on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Exposition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and Austin&emdash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basil exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Vanessa wait at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's gather your personal effects,  shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLERK brings out a locker-basket and reads off a list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) Danger Powers, personal effects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, my name's Austin Powers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says here, name Danger Powers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danger's my middle name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

The young bull says,  'hey, why don't we run down the hill  and shag us a cow?', and the wise  old bull replies, 'no, why don't we  walk down the hill and shag all the  cows?'

dialogues.text: Austin Powers is getting too close.   He must be neutralized.  Any  suggestions?

dialogues.text: Ya wohl&emdash I mean, yes wohl,  Herr Doctor.  I have created the  ultimate weapon to defeat Austin  Powers.  Bring on the Fembots!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC:  Sexy Matt Helm-type theme THREE FEMBOTS enter.  T are beautiful buxom multiracial girl/robots in Sixties cl and white go-go boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathtaking, Frau.  These automated  strumpets are the perfect bait for  the degenerate Powers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the latest word in android  replicant technology.  Lethal,  efficient, brutal.  And no man can  resist their charms.  Send in the  soldiers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVEN SOLDIERS come in.  They are immediately attracted t the FEMBOTS.  They throw down their guns and come to the  girls zombie-like. When they get within range, guns POP out of the Fembots'  bras and begin FIRING, killing the guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Herr Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to see girls of that caliber.   By caliber, I mean both the barrel  size of their guns and the high  quality of their character...Forget  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be the video feed from  Kreplachistan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil and Number Two watch a large screen.  We see sto footage of a Russian warhead.  We cut into a close-up of  RUSSIAN SOLDIERS being taken prisoner by VIRTUCON SOLDIER in the front of a military vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, Phase One is complete.   The warhead is ours.  Let Phase Two  begin!  Patch us through to the United  Nations security secret meeting room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPRESENTATIVES of various countries in their traditional garb around a large UN-style meeting table.  The BRITISH dressed in bowler hats.  The AMERICANS all look like JFK. The CANADIANS are dressed as Mounties.  The ARABS are dre in ceremonial robes, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, my name is Dr. Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look up at the SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a little while, you'll find out  that the Kreplachistani warhead has  gone missing.  Well, it's in safe  hands.  If you want it back, you'll  have to pay me...ONE MILLION DOLLARS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The UN representatives are confused.  Number Two COUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Sorry.  ONE-HUNDRED BILLION DOLLARS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The representatives ARGUE amongst themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, silence! (to Dr. Evil)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOW, MR. EVIL&EMDASH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Doctor Evil!  I didn't spend six  years in evil medical school to be  called 'mister'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  Dr. Evil, it is the policy  of the United Nations not to negotiate  with terrorists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, have it your way.  Gentlemen,  you have five days to come up with  one

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hundred billion dollars.  If you fail to do so, we'll set off the warhead and destroy the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't destroy the world with a  single warhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  So long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen goes BLANK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to evil associates) Gentlemen, in exactly five days from  now, we will be one-hundred billion  dollars richer. (laughing) Ha-ha-ha-ha. (slightly louder) Ha-ha-ha-ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing with him) Ha-ha-ha-ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. EVIL & ASSOCIATES (LOUDER AND MORE STACCATO)

dialogues.speaker: HA-HA-HA-HA-HA
dialogues.text: (louder again, and even more evil and maniacal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhh, ahhhhhh... (pause, quieter) Ohhh, hmmmm. (pause, very quiet) hmn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an uncomfortable pause, because clearly we shoul have FADED TO BLACK.  The evil associates look around the room, not knowing what to do with themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...Well...I think I'm going to  watch some TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit the frame awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Vanessa enter past two BRITISH MILITARY POLICE There is a communications center, a makeshift armory, bun etc. We see Basil, dressed as the Vegas-era Elvis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Exposition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, Vanessa, let me bring you up  to speed.  Dr. Evil has high-jacked  a nuclear warhead from Kreplachistan  and is holding the world ransom for  one-hundred billion dollars.  If the  world doesn't pay up in four days,  he's threatening to destroy the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Exposition.  Only two  things, scare me, and one is nuclear  war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the other thing you're scared  of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Circus folk. (shudders) Nomads, you know.  They smell like  cabbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suffering him) Indeed...If we could get back to the  business at hand.  It's one thing to  have a warhead, it's quite another  thing to have the missiles to launch  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe these photographs are the last  piece of that puzzle. (hands him the photos) I've uncovered the details on Project  Vulcan.  It's a new subterranean  warhead delivery system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God, and underground missile.   We've long feared such a development.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you find that out, Austin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin did some reconnaissance work  at Alotta Fagina's penthouse last  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our next move is to infiltrate  Virtucon.  Any ideas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Virtucon runs a tour of their  facilities every hour.  I suggest we  pose as tourists and do site-level  reconnaissance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top drawer, Kensington.  Oh, Austin,  I want you to meet somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basil waves to an extremely frail ELDERLY BRITISH LADY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, this is my mother, Mrs.  Exposition.  She's in from Tunbridge  Wells

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in Kent.  Can you believe, she's ninety-two years old? Austin hauls off and PUNCHES the lady in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, Austin, what have you done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not your mother, that's a  man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin begins tugging on her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owww...my hair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from my mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, have you gone mad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two guards come over and help Mrs. Exposition to a co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through pain) Who is that man?  Why did he hit me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, mother.  Lie down.   Austin, you have a lot of explaining  to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Basil, I thought she was  a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, man!  You're talking about  my mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must admit, she is rather mannish.   No offense, but if that's a woman,  it looks like she's been beaten with  an ugly stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, Austin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at her hands, baby!  Those are  carpenter's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Austin, I think you should  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think if everyone were honest,  they'd confess that the lady looks  exactly like a man in drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving! (pause) Oh, and Austin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Basil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basil escorts his mother out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, may I have a word with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, luv.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I know I'm just being  neurotic, but I can't shake this  suspicious

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: feeling about that Italian secretary, Ms. Fagina.  I mean don't want to sound paranoid, but I've had some bad  relationships in the past, and I have some jealousy issue You went to her penthouse.  It makes me feel so small to  give into these insecurities, but I can't help but feel t weird, irrational, unfocused...well, jealousy.  I'm sorry

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be sorry.  You're right to be  suspicious.  I shagged her.  I shagged  her rotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) I can't believe you made love to her  just like that.  Did you use  protection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, I had my nine-millimeter  automatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, did you use a condom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only sailors use condoms, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in the Nineties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well they should, filthy beggars,  they go from port to port.  Alotta  meant nothing to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Well, it means something to me.  If  you want us to have a relationship,  you've got to be a one-woman man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just a shag, Vanessa.  You're  everything to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just don't get it, do you, Austin?   Good night.  Welcome to the Nineties,  you're going to be very lonely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC:  "What the World Needs Now" by BURT BACHARACH Aust looks at his address book.  ANGLE ON THE PAGE:  We see a  list of names crossed out, with comments written in beside them.  Beside Jimi Hendrix we "Deceased, Drugs"; Janis Joplin, "Deceased, Alcohol"; Mam Cass, "Deceased, Ham Sandwich"; Jerry Garcia. "Deceased,  Gratefully"; Jane Fonda, "Square". Austin looks at his old pair of Sixties-era canvas sneake He picks up his new pair&emdash REEBOK SHAQ CROSS-TRA PUMPS.  He pumps them too much and they explode. Austin looks out his window at the lonely city below.  We see the CDs he's just purchased, including SERGEANT PEPPE and BURT BACHARACH'S GREATEST HITS. Austin goes over to the kitchenette and puts a can of uno Campbell's Tomato Soup in the microwave and turns it on. explodes in a shower of sparks and soup. He puts the CD on a record player and drops the needle. NOISE is awful. Austin plays MORTAL COMBAT III.  His fighter gets his hea ripped off, and blood spews out. Austin is genuinely frightened by this.

dialogues.text: Austin attempts to use the Water Pik, but the head is too loose and water shoots all around the bathroom.

dialogues.text: Austin sits watching the TIME-LIFE The Last Thirty Years  video on TV.  Vanessa enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, luv.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty years of political and social  upheaval.  The fall of the Berlin  wall, a female Prime Minister of  England, the abolishment of Apartheid,  a fascinating tapestry of human strum  und drang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can't believe Liberace was  gay.  Women loved him, man.  I didn't  see that one coming.

dialogues.text: Basil was very concerned to know  where you were last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out and about, doing odds and sods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell him.  By the way, I've  decided we should keep our  relationship strictly professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the middle of a group therapy session, containin six or seven FATHERS with their teenage SONS.  It is  emotionally charged.  A lot of pained expressions and cof in Styrofoam cups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) I love you, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hug.  Everyone APPLAUDS.  We see Dr. Evil and Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was great, Mr. Keon, Dave.   Thank you.  OK, group, we have two  new member.  Say hello to Scott and  his father, Mr....Ehville?

dialogues.text: Evil, actually, Doctor Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Dr. Evil.  Hello, Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into it) Hello, everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Scott, why don't we start with  you.  Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's kind of weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't judge here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.  Well, I just really met my Dad  for the first time three days ago.   He was partially frozen for thirty  years.  I never knew him growing up.   He comes back and now he wants me to  take over the family business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how do you feel about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna take over the family  business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Scott, who's going to take over  the world when I die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to do, Scott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I was thinking, maybe  I'd be a vet or something, cause I  like animals and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An evil vet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Maybe, like, work in a petting  zoo or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An evil petting zoo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) You always do that! (calm) Anyways, this is really hard, because,  you know, my Dad is really evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't label people here, Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's really evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the boy's right.  I really am  evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be so hard on yourself.  You're  here, that's what's important.  A  journey of a thousand miles begins  with one step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think, like, he hates me.  I  really think he wants to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, Scott, no one really wants to  "kill" anyone here.  They say it,  but they don't mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, the boy's quite astute.  I  am trying to kill him.  My Evil  Associates have cautioned against  it, so here he is, unfortunately,  alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've heard from Scott, now let's  hear from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The details of my life are quite  inconsequential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true, Doctor.  Please,  tell us about your childhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course.  Go ahead, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well, where should I begin?  My  father was a relentlessly self- improving boulangerie owner from  Belgium with low-grade narcolepsy  and a penchant for buggery.  My mother  was a fifteen-year-old French  prostitute named Chloe with webbed  feet.  My father would womanize, he  would drink, he would make outrageous  claims, like he invented the question  mark.  Sometimes he would accuse  chestnuts of being lazy.  A sort of  general malaise that only the genius  possess and the insane lament.  My  childhood was typical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summers in Rangoon, luge lessons.  In the spring we'd mak meat helmets.  If I was insolent, I was placed in a burla bag and beaten with reeds.  Pretty standard, really.  At age of twelve I received my first scribe.  At the age of fifteen, a Zoroastrian named Vilma ritualistically shaved my testicles.  There really is nothing like a shaw scrotum.  At the age of eighteen, I went off to evil medi school.  From there... ANGLE ON THE THERAPIST AND THE GROUP.  They are stunned.

dialogues.speaker: PSYCHEDELC SCENE BREAK
dialogues.text: MUSIC:  Psychedelic Wa-wa Pedal Funky Drummer Beat TITLE  GRAPHIC:  Sock It To Me Austin and the go-go girl dance  crazily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TOUR is in progress.  Austin, Vanessa, and other TOURIS ride on an electric tram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since I've been unfrozen, I've had a  rancid taste in my mouth.  Do you  have a piece of gum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in her own world) Do you think she's prettier than I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Don't lay your hang-ups on me,  Vanessa.  You're being very trippy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking at you, and the whole  time I can't help thinking you had  your willie inside her hootchie-kooch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well put.  Listen love, we can't  keep having this fight.  I'm an  International Man of Mystery.   Sometimes in the course of my work  to save the world I have to shag  some crumpet.  It's all part of the  job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Virtucon, the company of  the future. (pointing to large  display window) Virtucon is a leading manufacturer  of many items you'll find right in  your own home.  We make steel,  volatile chemicals, petroleum-based  products, and we also own the Franklin  mint, which makes decorative hand- painted theme plates for collectors. (holds up plate) Some plates, like the Gone With The  Wind series, have gone up in value  as much as two-hundred and forty  percent, but, as with any investment,  there is some risk involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people on the tour APPLAUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming up on the left, we have the  Virtucon gift shop, offering a wide  range of Virtucon licensed products.   On the right, you'll notice a door  that leads to a restricted area.   Only authorized personnel are allowed  beyond that point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the tourists head for the gift shop.  Austin notices SEVEN-FOOT-TALL SCIENTIST leaving the "RESTRICTED AREA" w a FOUR-HUNDRED-POUND FEMALE SCIENTIST.  They both wear  Virtucon coveralls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take him, you take her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seven-foot-tall male scientist goes to the men's room the four-hundred-pound woman goes to the ladies room.  Au and Vanessa follow. We hear from inside either washroom the sound of PEOPLE B KNOCKED OUT. Austin and Vanessa exit wearing the scientists' coveralls over their clothes.  Magically, the coveralls fit perfect They go through the doors into the restricted area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach the security GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, we don't look anything like  our photo badges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, baby.  I picked up a  mind control technique during my  travels to India.  I learned it from  my guru, the late Guru Shastri, a  chaste man who mysteriously died of  a disease that had all the hallmarks  of syphilis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just watch me.  Watch me, now. They reach the guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, folks.  You're entering a  restricted zone.  Can I see your  security badges?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: RAISING ONE EYEBROW AND THEN THE

dialogues.text: (hypnotist-like) Everything seems to be in order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the badges) Hey, wait a minute&emdash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON AUSTIN.  He redoubles his eye-brow-raising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trance-like, in  Austin's English  accent) Everything seems to be in order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's amazing.  Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on one second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin again does his mind control trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, have a piece of gum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in trace) Here, have a piece of gum.

dialogues.text: He hands Austin a piece of gum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mind if I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slipping out of trance) Hey!  Wait a minute, that's my last  piece of gum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin does his mind-control again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I want you to have it, even  if it's my last piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trance-like) No, no, I want you to have it, even  if it's my last piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mind-controlling) I'm going to go across the street  and get you some sherbert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) Austin, we have to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faintly) I'm going to go across the street  and get you some sherbert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Vanessa come to a door marked "PROJECT VULCAN TOP SECRET."  They walk through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, SCIENTISTS wearing head-to-toe radiation suits  surround and inspect a huge diamond-encrusted drill bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the strongest, sharpest drill  bit ever produced by man.  It weighs  fifteen metric tones and can bore  through a mile-thick bedrock of solid  granite in seven seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECURITY GUARD and the tour guide take a head count.  T notice Austin and Vanessa's empty seats on the tram.  The guard speaks into his walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on PA) Attention, there are intruders in  the complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the radiation suited scientists turn to look at Austi and Vanessa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scientist approach.  Austin knocks two of them out co with judo chops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa knocks two of them out using roundhouse kicks.   SECURITY GUARDS flood into the room from the hallway.  Au and Vanessa take off through another side door which read

dialogues.text: It is a room the size of a large gymnasium overseen by a  large observation booth.  Six STEAMROLLER go around a tes track very slowly. Austin and Vanessa hide behind one of the slowly moving  steamrollers.  Security guards enter the facility and beg fanning out in a search.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our only way out of here is to drive  out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb up the back of a steamroller, KNOCK OUT the DR push him off, and assume the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two SECURITY GUYS jump on either side of the steamroller. Vanessa wrestles the machine gun off on and pushes him aw Austin punches the other one off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on!  I'm going to floor it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He engages a lever.  It goes only slightly faster. TWO SECURITY GUARDS jump in front of the steamroller.  Th are acting like they're frozen, ad if in the headlights o fast-approaching car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooooooooooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you learn to shoot?

dialogues.text: Oh, I fell over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their heads explode simultaneously.  All the Fembots are  lying on the floor, smoking.  Just then, Vanessa enters,  flanked by a COUPLE OF COMMANDOS.  She surveys the scene looks at Austin in his briefs.  She's hurt.  The commando salute Austin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what it looks like, Vanessa. (to the commandos) At ease, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing down) Likewise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can explain.  They attacked me.   Gas came out of her...well, and then  they...and I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you, Austin.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a tick, let me put on my  togs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Vanessa lead FIFTEEN COMMANDOS into the chambe and GUNFIRE breaks out.  Two CATWALKS run the length of t chamber, meeting at the door to the control area. The commandos split into two groups and lob grenades at t PRIVATE ARMY SOLDIERS who are guarding the stairs leading the catwalks.  They go flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ALARM goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Activate the blast shutters!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metal shutters automatically cover the windows overlookin the probe mechanism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Launch the subterranean probe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giant probe engine begins to throb and whirl.  The ti of the spinning probe suddenly strikes the floor of the  chamber and burrows into the earth with atomic force.  Sm and debris explode upwards.  The entire chamber quakes  violently&emdash eight on the Richter scale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have penetration.  Subterranean  detonation&emdash two minutes and  COUN-ting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, Vanessa, and three commandos are pinned down behi several VIRTUCON BARRELS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another FOUR GUARDS block their way.  Austin goes to shoo but he's out of bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Vanessa run along the  catwalk towards the control room.   They're directly in the path of TEN  CHARGING PRIVATE ARMY SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me!  We're going to have to  jump over the rail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry!

dialogues.speaker: SIDE SHOT OF CATWALK
dialogues.text: They continue to run towards the guards behind some STACK BARRELS.  Two OBVIOUS STUNT DOUBLES run out from behind t barrels in a continuous motion instead of Austin and Vane and diver over the rail.

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER TEAM OF COMMANDOS
dialogues.text: They are making progress on the other catwalk.

dialogues.speaker: AUSTIN AND VANESSA
dialogues.text: They have landed safely, but are surrounded by FIVE PRIVA ARMY SOLDIERS, armed to the teeth&emdash one has a bazooka, one has a flamethrower, one has a Gatl gun, etc.  They see Austin and throw down their weapons,  pulling out KNIVES. One of the private soldiers runs at Austin and he stabs h Another soldier runs at Austin, and Austin also stabs him A third private army soldier runs at Austin.  Austin does the stabbing motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blast!  Out of ammo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa unleashes a series of kicks, knocking them all ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin begins to enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, I'm coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going it alone this time, Vanessa.   I have a follow-up visit with the  Evil Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll secure the perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin enters the control area.  A VIRTUCON ARMY MAN fire at him.  Austin returns fires, shooting up some electrica equipment.  Live wires dangle dangerously.  Austin sees M Bigglesworth running out a read door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, Mr. Bigglesworth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin heads for the door until he smacks into AN INVISIB FORCE FIELD.  He turns and sees a bank of old-fashioned  computers labeled "DESTRUCTACON 5000".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Mr. Powers, I'm the  Destructacon 5000.  I'm programmed  to prevent you from progressing beyond  this point.  You might as well  surrender.  Resistance is futile.   Your odds of survival are 23,763,273  to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Destructacon 5000, you have  quite a head on your shoulders, I  dare to coin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am programmed to answer any  question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  Let me ask you this.  What  is love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That does not compute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?  It's a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love is...love is...love is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The computers begin to smoke.  Alarm bells ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remjack!  Remjack! (singing) Daisy, Daisy... (faster) Remjackremjackremjack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a muffled explosion.  The computer goes dark.  A passes through the force field and heads for the door unt he hears&emdash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on PA) Subterranean detonation&emdash one  minute and COUN-ting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins looking furiously for the abort button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eastern European  Man) Where's the abort button?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Eastern European Man holds up his finger as if to say 'give me one second.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on PA) Forty-five seconds and COUN-ting. (to Austin) It's right over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin sees the abort button.  It is across the room.  Ju then, Random Task enters.  Austin sees him and goes to sh him, but he has run out of bullets.  Random task takes of his SHOE. Austin makes his way across the room to the button. Random Task THROWS HIS SHOE.

dialogues.speaker: SHOE SPINNING IN THE AIR
dialogues.text: The shoe HITS AUSTIN IN THE HEAD.  Austin pauses.  The sh has not killed him.  It has just hurt him slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!  That really hurt.  I'm going to  have a lump there, you idiot!  Who  throws a shoe?  You fight like a  woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on PA) Fifteen seconds and COUN-ting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Random task blocks Austin's way to the button.  He stands there, menacing, missing one shoe. Exposed wires are everywhere.  On the counter beside Aust is a Big Gulp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Care for a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin throws the drink at Random Task's feet.  It lands front of him on a pile of exposed wires.  Electricity tra through the Big Gulp, up Random Task's wet sock, ELECTROC him. He begins to SMOKE, and then dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three...two...one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 50 kiloton explosion from deep in the earth rocks the  control area.

dialogues.speaker: VOLCANOS ERUPTING
dialogues.text: Different volcanoes around the world.  Lava spews and flo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin dives in SLOW MOTION towards the abort button.  He flies through the air for an inordinate length of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slow motion distortion) Nooooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hand lands on the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on PA) Abort.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE VOLCANO ERUPTIONS
dialogues.text: Lava, smoke and debris sucks back into volcanoes around t world.  (Eruption footage run in reverse.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having saved the world, Austin picks up a MACHIEN GUN fro fallen Private Army guy and runs to the door at the back, chasing Dr. Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin chases after Dr. Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin bursts in, catching Dr. Evil packing a suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got you, Dr. Evil!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, Mr. Powers.  We're not so  different, you and I.  It's true,  you're British, and I'm Belgian.   You have a full head of hair, mine  is slightly receding.  You're thin,  I'm about forty pounds overweight.   OK, we are different, I'm not making  a very good point.  However, isn't  it ironic, Mr. Powers, that the very  things you stand for&emdash swinging,  free love, parties, distrust of  authority- are all now, in the  Nineties, considered to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: be...evil?  Maybe we have more in common than you care to admit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, man, what we swingers were  rebelling against were uptight squares  like you, whose bag was money and  world domination.  We were innocent,  man.  If we'd known the consequences  of our sexual liberation, we would  have done things differently, but  the spirit would have remained the  same.  It's freedom, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your freedom has cause more pain and  suffering in the world than any plan  I ever dreamed of.  Face it, freedom  failed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why right now is a very groovy  time, man.  We still have freedom,  but we also have responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, there's nothing more pathetic  than an aging hipster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alotta enters.  She holds a gun to Vanessa's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it seems the tables have turned,  Mr. Powers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Scott Evil enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Dad, I can take my Sega, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin grabs Scott and puts the gun to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems the tables have turned again,  Dr. Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.  Kill the little bastard.   See what I care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you are one chilly square!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, we just made a breakthrough in  group!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had the group liquidated, you little  shit.  They were insolent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you!  I hate you!  I wish I  was never artificially created in a  lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott, don't say that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott runs off.  In the confusion, Vanessa KNOCKS the gun out of Alotta's hands.  Alotta pulls out a knife.  Austin SHOOTS the knife out of her hand.  Vanessa grabs Alotta b the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for sleeping with my man,  you whore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't sleep with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choking) It's the teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, I believe you.  But you still  must be chopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa gives her a judo chop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judo chop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Dr. Evil has run to the egg shaped rocket, whi closes and begins to lift up through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on PA) Five minutes to self-destruct and  COUN-ting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin SHOOTS and misses.  Rocket exhaust pours out of th hole in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's split!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Vanessa run out the door into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass Number Two, who is front of an open safe, stuff his pockets with cash while the others are trying to esca Austin and Vanessa run to the main chamber...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to the main corridor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...past the Fembot lair, over the wedged-in cart, to the  escape ladder.  They begin to climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explosions, debris, the cavern begins to collapse.

dialogues.speaker: STOCK FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: Ground caving in from an underground nuclear explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Vanessa are floating in a large inflatable raf FIERY DEBRIS falls in the water around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay it on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Austin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fab, because I love you, too,  Vanessa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Vanessa draw towards each other, preparing for passionate kiss.  Just as their lips are about to touch,  however, they are interrupted by a strong WIND and the no of a HELICOPTER OVERHEAD.  Their hair is blown all about the waves are whipped into a frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just when things were getting  interesting.

dialogues.speaker: ON A ROPE FROM THE HELICOPTER. HE
dialogues.text: stops just above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Austin, you've stopped Dr.  Evil from destroying the world with  his subterranean nuclear probe, and  somehow you and Agent Kensington  managed to escape unscathed from his  evil lair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say that about sums it up,  Exposition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite, actually.  Vanessa, I  have something for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basil hands Vanessa an official-looking set of leather-bo credentials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of your exemplary service to  Her Majesty, you are now officially  an active Field Agent with all the  privileges and responsibilities  thereof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Exposition.  I'm honored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Field Agent  Kensington!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, I have something for you as  well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands him a business card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the number of my dentist,  he's first rate.  Ring him up, he'll  look after you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Basil.  Maybe the Nineties  aren't so bad after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Austin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Vanessa embrace and kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, now, about your next  mission&emdash Still kissing Vanessa,  Austin motions with his thumbs to  the pilot of the helicopter to lift  Basil up.  He rises away in mid- sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising up) But, wait, I&emdash you got me again.   Oh, and Austin&emdash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Yes Basil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising) Be careful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Vanessa kiss again.  The helicopter blows them around.  The CAMERA TILTS UP to the sky and continues to  rise, until we are in&emdash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see DR. EVIL'S CAPSULE in orbit around the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you yet, Austin Powers!

dialogues.speaker: END CREDITS ROLL
dialogues.text: LAST CREDIT reads "SEE AUSTIN POWERS IN YOU ONLY FLOSS ON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you can get all the Austin Powers  movies in one Laser Disk box set!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virtucon Home Video presents "The Powers Collection."

dialogues.speaker: DISPLAY TABLE
dialogues.text: With five laser Disks laid out, alongside a PK-47, Austin glasses, and floss and a toothbrush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relive all your favorite Austin Powers  movies, including...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 141  GRAINY, BLACK & WHITE CLIP Showing Mike as Austin Powers, with Fifties hair and suit against a rear projection of explosions and stunts from s footage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Middle Name:  Danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Dr. Evil, do you expect the world  to pay the ransom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mr. Powers, I expect them to  die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Austin Powers collection would be  complete without some of the later  hits, like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four Eyes Only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Austin from behind, talking to a GIRL in a bathing suit.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL IN BATHING SUIT
dialogues.text: Oh, Austin, kiss me. He turns around.  It's Austin Powers, played by ROGER MOO with the same glasses and bad teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, behave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does a frightening grin, displaying the AWFUL TEETH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've also included some of the more  obscure hits, like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From India With Affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Austin Powers played by an INDIAN GENTLEMEN, same  glasses, same bad teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Indian accent) Well, my good fellow, are you  expecting me to pay the ransom to  you, you despot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Indian accent) No kind sir, I expect you to go up  in the evolutionary chain.  But first,  I expect you to sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing, Indian atonal) 'IF MUSIC BE THE FOOD OF LOVE, LET'S  BAKE A CAKE.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the Austin Powers adventures in  one Laser Disk boxed set!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behave!
